conclusion: To determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the flow patterns and the positions of the liquid outlets (A, B, C, and D) relative to the baffles (E and F).
Outlet A: Red arrow pointing to the left
Outlet B: Red arrow pointing to the right
Outlet C: Red arrow pointing up
Outlet D: Red arrow pointing down
Baffle E: Red arrow pointing to the left
Baffle F: Red arrow pointing to the right

premise: Outlet A: Red arrow pointing to the left
conclusion: Outlet A will flow into the left container (E).

premise: Outlet B: Red arrow pointing to the right
conclusion: Outlet B will flow into the right container (F).

premise: Outlet C: Red arrow pointing up
conclusion: Outlet C will flow into the upper container (F).

premise: Outlet D: Red arrow pointing down
conclusion: Outlet D will flow into the lower container (E).

premise: The analysis of flow patterns from outlets A, B, C, and D.
conclusion: The liquid will flow into container E after passing through baffles E and F.
